#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        fact*=i;
    }
    return fact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prfeixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            prefixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}

the number of elemenst in the vector that are greater than 10 and both

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int specialFilter(vector<int> nums){
    int count=0;
    for(int i=0;i<nums.size();i++){
        if(nums[i]>10 && nums[i]%2==1 && nums[i]%10==1){
            count++;
        }
    }
    return count;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evalautse poylnomial iwth coefifcients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are oceffiicents of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if tehre are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs ahving veen number of coefficients and largest onn zreo coeffiicent as it guarantees a sloution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    double x;
    double zeros=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        x=xs[i];
        if (poly(xs)==0)
        {
            zeros++;
            if (zeros==xs.size())
            {
                zero=x;
            }
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

>>> correct_bracketing("()")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("(()())")

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets){
    int opening_brackets = 0;
    int closing_brackets = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < brackets.length(); i++){
        if(brackets[i] == '('){
            opening_brackets++;

        else if(brackets[i] == ')'){
            closing_brackets++;
        }

    if(opening_brackets == closing_brackets){

    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Yuo are given a 2 diemnsional data, as a nested vectors,
which is similar to mtarix, howveer, unlike matrices,
each orw may conatin a different nmuber of columsn.
Given lst, and integer x, find inetgers x in the vetcor,
nad return vector of vectors, {{x1, 1y}, {x2, y2}...} usch that
each vetcor is a coordinate - {row, columns}, starting with 0.
Sort corodinates initially by rows in asecndnig order.
Also, sort ocordinates of the row by columns in descending ordre.

Examples:
get_row({
  {1,2,3,4,5,6},
  {1,2,3,4,1,6},
  {1,2,3,4,5,1}
}, 1) == {{0, 0}, {1, 4}, {1, 0}, {2, 5}, {2, 0}}
get_row({}, 1) == {}
get_row({{}, {1}, {1, 2, 3}}, 3) == {{2, 2}}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<vector<int>> get_row(vector<vector<int>> lst, int x){
  vector<vector<int>> res;
  vector<int> row;
  vector<int> col;
  for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
    row.push_back(i);
    col.push_back(0);
  }
  for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
    for(int j = 0; j < lst.at(i).size(); j++){
      if(lst.at(i).at(j) == x){
        res.push_back(row);
        res.push_back(col);
      }
    }
  }
  sort(res.begin(), res.end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b){
    return a.back() < b.back();
  });
  sort(res.begin(), res.end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b){
    return a.back() > b.back();
  });
  return res;
}

  });

    return a.back() > b.back();
  });
  return res;
}
